qas.question: Who is a god of plague?
What is the meaning of Akkadia Apllu Enlil?
What title was given to the god Nergal?
Who was the Trojan priest of Apollo?

context: A number of non-Greek etymologies have been suggested for the name, The Hittite form Apaliunas (dx-ap-pa-li-u-na-aš) is attested in the Manapa-Tarhunta letter, perhaps related to Hurrian (and certainly the Etruscan) <a0_0>Aplu<a0_0/>, a god of plague, in turn likely from <a2_0>Akkadian Aplu Enlil<a2_0/> meaning simply "<a1_0>the son of Enlil<a1_0/>", a title that was given to the god Nergal, who was linked to Shamash, Babylonian god of the sun. The role of Apollo as god of plague is evident in the invocation of Apollo Smintheus ("mouse Apollo") by <a3_0>Chryses<a3_0/>, the Trojan priest of Apollo, with the purpose of sending a plague against the Greeks (the reasoning behind a god of the plague becoming a god of healing is of course apotropaic, meaning that the god responsible for bringing the plague must be appeased in order to remove the plague).
